robot.navigation

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.navigation.Navigator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The navigator class is in charge of the motors of the robot. ALL the motors, including the arms to capture blocks, arguably, this is the single most important class in the entire project, all commands sent to the navigator will be executed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigator()

      void addInstructions(NavInstruction instruction)

      double calcAngle(double x, double y) 
      static Navigator getInstance()

      Go Backward a set distance in cm

      Go foward a set distance in cm
      void goForward(double distance, boolean returnImmediately) 
      static boolean isMovingInX() 
      static boolean isMovingInY() 
      boolean isNavigating() 
      void run()
      This is the main navigation loop for the robot, as it moves, the loop will run always! If there are no places to go to, then the thread will wait until something notifies it to continue (assuming that whatever notifies it adds more information to the blocking queue before resuming the thread) Another thread MUST call the notify() function for this thread to be activated
      void setFloat()
      Float the two motors jointly
      static void setMovingInX(boolean movingInX) 
      static void setMovingInY(boolean movingInY)

      Functions to set the motor speeds jointly
      void stopMoving() 
      void travelTo(double x, double y)
      TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading
      void turnTo(double angle, boolean stop)
      TurnTo function which takes an angle and boolean as arguments The boolean controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed

      • run

        public void run()
        This is the main navigation loop for the robot, as it moves, the loop will run always! If there are no places to go to, then the thread will wait until something notifies it to continue (assuming that whatever notifies it adds more information to the blocking queue before resuming the thread) Another thread MUST call the notify() function for this thread to be activated
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
